title: By royal appointment ! Mary Earps , Dame Shirley Bassey and Emilia Clarke lead stars recognised in King New Year Honours list - with brave Tony Hudgell , nine - who is Kate Middleton  best friend  - the youngest recipient of a gong
body_text:
By royal appointment! Mary Earps, Dame Shirley Bassey and Emilia Clarke lead stars recognised in King's New Year's Honours list - with brave Tony Hudgell, nine - who is Kate Middleton's 'best friend' - the youngest recipient of a gong
Mary Earps, Dame Shirley Bassey, and Game of Thrones star Emilia Clarke lead the stars recognised in the King's New Year's Honours List - as Kate Middleton's brave 'best friend' Tony Hudgell is the youngest recipient of a gong.
The England and Manchester United shot-stopper is made an MBE for services to football after finishing runners-up to Spain in the women's World Cup.
It caps an extraordinary few weeks for Earps, 30, who recently picked up the BBC's 2023 Sports Personality of the Year in a public vote to become the 70th winner of the gong.
It has been a special year for her on and off the pitch. Though she kept a record 14 clean sheets in the league for Manchester United, it is her achievements in an England shirt that truly captured the nation's hearts.
While off the pitch she won a high profile battle with Nike and managed to reverse the kit manufacturer's decision not to sell replicas of her goalkeeper shirt during the World Cup. Since then it has twice gone on sale to the public, selling out in minutes on both occasions.
Mary Earps is made an MBE for services to football after finishing runners-up to Spain in the women's World Cup
It caps an extraordinary few weeks for Earps, 30, who recently picked up the BBC 's 2023 Sports Personality of the Year in a public vote (left)
Dame Shirley Bassey, who has sold more than 135 million records, is made Companion of Honour for her services to music, becoming the 64th living member of the order
Game Of Thrones star Emilia Clarke (right) has been made a MBE alongside her mother Jenny (left) as co-founders of SameYou, a brain injury recovery charity they established after she survived two brain haemorrhages
Clarke, who shot to fame playing the Mother of Dragons in the hit HBO series, said the honour was 'remarkable' and felt it was 'life-enhancing and magical' to see her mother, who has also had surgery to remove a brain aneurysm, also recognised for the work
Tony Hudgell (pictured on This Morning with his adoptive mother Paula Hudgell) is being awarded a British Empire Medal (BEM) for services to the prevention of child abuse
Tony, 9, is Kate Middleton's 'best friend' and is believed to be the youngest person to ever be recognised in the Honours List
Dame Shirley, who has sold more than 135 million records, is made Companion of Honour for her services to music, becoming the 64th living member of the order which can only have 65 members at any one time.
The iconic Welsh singer, who was born and grew up in Tiger Bay in Cardiff, said: 'My heart is full of emotion and I am truly humbled.'
Elsewhere, Game Of Thrones star Clarke has been made a MBE alongside her mother Jenny as co-founders of SameYou, a brain injury recovery charity they established after she survived two brain haemorrhages.
Clarke, who shot to fame playing the Mother of Dragons in the hit HBO series, said the honour was 'remarkable' and felt it was 'life-enhancing and magical' to see her mother, who has also had surgery to remove a brain aneurysm, also recognised for the work.
The Princess of Wales' 'best pal' Tony, 9, is the youngest to pick up a gong. He is being awarded a British Empire Medal (BEM) for services to the prevention of child abuse.
He has raised over £1.8million for the hospital that saved his life after he suffered horrific abuse as a baby in West Malling, Kent.
Along with his adoptive mother, he founded the Tony Hudgell Foundation in 2021 to support and help vulnerable children, and has also inspired an English law change to increase prison sentences for those convicted of child cruelty and neglect.
Tony, who raises money walking vast distances on prosthetics after his legs were amputated in infancy following his abuse, has struck up a special relationship with the Kate.
He met her for the second time at Evelina London Children’s Hospital earlier this month where she asked him to write her a story.
Tony is believed to be the youngest ever recipient of an honour, a record previously held by fundraiser Tobias Weller, who was 11 when he received a BEM two years ago.
Professor 'Lockdown' John Edmunds is to be knighted for services to epidemiology, including the modelling work that made the case for longer and tougher Covid lockdowns.

Sir Justin Welby, the Archbishop of Canterbury, is made a Knight Grand Cross of the Royal Victorian Order for his personal service to the Crown during the coronation at Westminster Abbey in May
Former Chancellor, Health Secretary, and Home Secretary Sajid Javid has been knighted
Great British Bake Off judge Paul Hollywood has been made an MBE in the New Year's Honours List
Glastonbury Festival founder Sir Michael Eavis, listed under his full name Athelstan Joseph Michael Eavis, said he was looking forward to his investiture after being knighted for services to music and charity
Director and producer Sir Ridley Scott, whose works include Gladiator, Alien and Napoleon, is made a Knight Grand Cross, upgrading his previous knighthood, while author Jilly Cooper becomes a dame.
She said: 'I am absolutely and incredibly bowled over. I cannot believe I am a DBE, which in my case also stands for Delighted, Bewildered and Ecstatic.'
Sir Justin Welby, the Archbishop of Canterbury, is made a Knight Grand Cross of the Royal Victorian Order (RVO) for his personal service to the Crown during the coronation at Westminster Abbey in May.
Awards of the RVO are in the King's gift and are bestowed independently of Downing Street to people who have served the monarch or the royal family in a personal way.
Sir Justin conducted the service for the coronation and had the momentous task of anointing and crowning Charles and Camilla.
Other notable names in the list include England cricketer Stuart Broad, who is made a Commander of the Order of the British Empire (CBE) following his retirement; singer Leona Lewis, who becomes an Officer of the Order of the British Empire (OBE); and author Kate Mosse, who is also made a CBE.
Other showbiz names honoured include radio disc jockey Tony Blackburn, who is made an OBE, fellow DJ Steve Wright, sports broadcasters Jeff Stelling and Hazel Irvine and Great British Bake Off judge Paul Hollywood, who each are made MBEs.
In politics, former chancellor and home secretary Sajid Javid has been knighted, Dame Margaret Beckett, Labour MP for Derby South, has had her damehood upgraded to a Dame Grand Cross, and Siobhain McDonagh, Labour MP for Mitcham and Morden, has been made a Dame Commander.
England cricketer Stuart Broad is made a Commander of the Order of the British Empire (CBE) following his retirement
England captain Millie Bright (right) has been made an OBE, while her fellow Lionesses Lauren Hemp (left) has been made an MBE for services to football
In rugby, Sir Bill Beaumont has been made Knight Grand Cross for services to rugby union football and to charity
Former rugby league players Rob Burrow (right) and Kevin Sinfield (left) have both been made CBEs for services to motor neurone disease awareness
In an unusual move, Liz Truss's resignation honours were published at the same time as the separate New Year Honours, more than 14 months after the end of her tumultuous 49 days as prime minister, when she was forced out of office after the budget outlined by her chancellor Kwasi Kwarteng sparked an economic crisis.
Mr Kwarteng is not on her list, but there are peerages for Matthew Elliott and Jon Moynihan, former chief executive and chairman respectively of Vote Leave, and her deputy chief of staff Ruth Porter, and honours for four MPs, two special advisers, her constituency Conservative Association chairman and author Shirley Conran.
Glastonbury Festival founder Sir Michael Eavis, listed under his full name Athelstan Joseph Michael Eavis, said he was looking forward to his investiture after being knighted for services to music and charity.
In an interview for the official Glastonbury website, Sir Michael said: 'I think William might do the ceremony.
'He's made a few mentions of wanting to come to the festival.
'So I'll probably take a couple of tickets in my pocket!'
In sport, England captain Millie Bright has been made an OBE, while her fellow Lionesses Lauren Hemp has been made an MBE for services to football after they finished runners-up to Spain in the women's World Cup.
Bright said she was 'gobsmacked' when she heard about the OBE, adding: 'It's something you never imagined, something that never crossed my mind.'
Hemp said: 'I'd like to dedicate my MBE to everyone that has supported me in my career so far, and everyone behind the scenes for continuing to push boundaries to get women's football to where it is today.'
Wetherspoon pub chain boss Tim Martin is knighted amid reports a Government minister pushed for his nomination to reward his Brexit campaigning
Author Kate Mosse a co-founder of the Women's Prize for Fiction, has been made CBE for services to literature, to women and to charity
The oldest recipient is Jill Gladwell, 97, from Stowmarket, who has become an MBE for her voluntary services to the Royal British Legion in Suffolk
In rugby, Sir Bill Beaumont has been made Knight Grand Cross for services to rugby union football and to charity, while former Scotland star and record try-scorer Stuart Hogg is made an MBE.
Wetherspoon pub chain boss Tim Martin is knighted amid reports a Government minister pushed for his nomination to reward his Brexit campaigning.
Sir Tim, who was knighted for services to hospitality and culture, said: 'I'd like to think that (the knighthood) is not for my rarely disclosed political views - I hope it is for what it says on the tin.'
Novelist Ms Mosse, a co-founder of the Women's Prize for Fiction, has been made CBE for services to literature, to women and to charity.
She said: 'It does feel that although obviously this is for me, it's very much an acknowledgement of the importance of the Women's Prize, and that it matters that women support other women.'
Former director of public prosecutions Max Hill, who stepped down in October after five years in the role, is made Knight Commander of the Order of the Bath.
Sir Max Hill KC, said: 'My time at the Crown Prosecution Service was marked by unprecedented challenges including the pandemic and striving to improve the criminal justice response to rape and domestic violence.
'I am very grateful for this honour, which is a testament to the thousands of CPS staff and prosecution advocates who work tirelessly to help victims and to deliver justice.'
Radio disc jockey legened Tony Blackburn has been made an OBE in the New Year's Eve Honours List
This year's list includes a total of 1,227 recipients, 48% of whom are women, while 13.8% come from an ethnic minority background.
The oldest recipient is Jill Gladwell, 97, from Stowmarket, who has become an MBE for her voluntary services to the Royal British Legion in Suffolk.
Ian Russell, father of 14-year-old Molly Russell, who took her own life after viewing harmful material on social media, has become an MBE for services to child safety online.
Last September, a coroner ruled schoolgirl Molly, from Harrow, north-west London, died from 'an act of self-harm while suffering from depression and the negative effects of online content' in November 2017.
Mr Russell has set up the Molly Rose Foundation suicide prevention charity in her memory and has contributed to the establishment of the Online Safety Bill.
On what Molly would have made of his MBE, he said: 'Molly was quite content to get on stage and take part in school plays, but she was a quiet person, she didn't like the limelight, so I think she would have found this a bit strange.
'But because she was such a caring person I think she would have been tremendously proud of being able to help people who may be struggling with their mental health and may be beginning to have thoughts about suicide.
'If she thought she could help those people live long and stay strong, she'd be very proud indeed.'
Ian Russell (left), father of 14-year-old Molly Russell (right), who took her own life after viewing harmful material on social media, has become an MBE for services to child safety online
Former rugby league players Rob Burrow and Kevin Sinfield have both been made CBEs for services to motor neurone disease (MND) awareness.
Burrow won eight Super League titles with Leeds and represented Great Britain and England before he announced he had been diagnosed with MND at the age of 37 in 2019.
Inspired by his former Leeds team-mate, Sinfield this month battled through a gruelling schedule of running seven ultramarathons in as many days in seven different cities around Britain and Ireland.
His latest fundraising challenge to help people living with MND raised more than £1 million.
Prime Minister Rishi Sunak said: 'The New Year's Honours List recognises the exceptional achievements of people across the country and those who have shown the highest commitment to selflessness and compassion.
'To all honourees, you are the pride of this country and an inspiration to us all.'
